bug.author: myungjoo
bug.description:
Whenever there is pkg name or version changes in Tizen:Base, we often get gbs build errors, which requires gbs-clean. Although we can resolve this manually by cleaning up gbs-root or go gbs-clean whenever we see this issue, there are mechanisms possibly avoid such issues automatically. Approach 1.
Fix gbs. Let it clean up rpm-db if obs repo is updated.
The ideal and clean fix. Effective upstream: https://review.tizen.org/gerrit/gitweb?p=tools/gbs.git;a=summary Used-to-be upstream: https://github.com/intel/gbs
Approach 2.
Do gbs build --clean every Monday (cron.daily)
The dumbest, but quite effective fix. If release engineers update Tizen:Base during weekdays, this will fail and we'll need to clean up manually.
Evolved version: do gbs build --clean ${iterate-all-arch} if http://download.tizen.org/snapshots/tizen/base/ gets update. (detect with cron.d)
Simplest, fully-automated, and possibly robust as Approach 4.
Approach 3.
Add web interface (a button) to do gbs build --clean or rm -rf $GBSROOT
Kinda manual, but not that PITA.
Approach 4.
When TAOS detects gbs build errors, it reads the fail log and if it appears that it has failed before %prep / %build section, retry once with --clean option
The simplest, fully-automated, and robust method.
If anyone's upset with the outage of 2010-01-14's GBS failures, you are the one who may dare to do this :) This is glitches created by using the "latest" symbolic links, which change target locations for every snapshot release.
